embed: <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/bwwf_HbEJQM?version=3&f=videos&app=youtube_gdata"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/bwwf_HbEJQM?version=3&f=videos&app=youtube_gdata" allowscriptaccess="always" height="344" width="425" allowfullscreen="true" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"></embed></object>
summary:
Due to its robust namespacing, Python uniquely equips developers to write and
distribute reusable code. The Python community has a tool for this: the Python
Package Index. PyPI is a massive repository of code, and in this talk you'll
learn how to take code that you've written it and register and distribute it
for use by others.
title: Sharing is Caring: Posting to the Python Package Index
